title: High Female Participation in Business Ownership
description: In 2017, 70.4% of firms in Ecuador had female participation in ownership, one of the highest rates globally.

title: Extensive Formal Training in Firms
description: As of 2017, 73.7% of firms in Ecuador offered formal training, indicating a strong commitment to employee development.

title: Minimal Unemployment Benefits Coverage for the Poorest
description: In 2022, only 0.0046% of the poorest quintile in Ecuador received unemployment benefits or active labor market programs, one of the lowest coverages worldwide.

title: Low Self-Employment Among Female Children
description: In 2015, only 0.14% of female children aged 7-14 in Ecuador were self-employed, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: Low Self-Employment Among Male Children
description: In 2015, 0.31% of male children aged 7-14 in Ecuador were self-employed, reflecting one of the lowest rates worldwide.

title: Low Self-Employment Among Children
description: In 2015, 0.24% of children aged 7-14 in Ecuador were self-employed, one of the lowest percentages globally.
